qas.question: What was founded after the fall of the Ming?
The Qing dynasty lasted through what time period?
What were the Manchus originally known as?
Why did the last Ming Emperor commit suicide?

answers.text: Beijing was captured by Li Zicheng's peasant rebels

qas.question: Who became allies with the Manchus to seize control over Beijing?
The Qing dynasty formed after what event?

answers.text: after the fall of the Ming

qas.question: During what time period did the Qing dynasty rule?
What were the Manchus originally named?
Who was Beijing captured by in 1644?
Who did the Manchus make an Ally with to seize control of Beijing?

context: <a0_0>The Qing dynasty<a0_0/> (<a1_0><a6_0>1644–1911<a6_0/><a1_0/>) was founded <a5_0>after the fall of the Ming<a5_0/>, the last Han Chinese dynasty, by the Manchus. The Manchus were formerly known as <a2_0>the <a7_0>Jurchens<a7_0/><a2_0/>. When <a3_0>Beijing was captured by <a8_0>Li Zicheng's peasant rebels<a8_0/><a3_0/> in 1644, the Chongzhen Emperor, the last Ming emperor, committed suicide. The Manchus then allied with <a4_0><a9_0>former Ming general Wu Sangui<a9_0/><a4_0/> and seized control of Beijing, which became the new capital of the Qing dynasty. The Mancus adopted the Confucian norms of traditional Chinese government in their rule of China proper. Schoppa, the editor of The Columbia Guide to Modern Chinese History argues, "A date around 1780 as the beginning of modern China is thus closer to what we know today as historical 'reality'. It also allows us to have a better baseline to understand the precipitous decline of the Chinese polity in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries."
